title: FR Doc 07-4596 - Assessment Dividends
summary: The FDIC seeks comments on methods for allocating dividends to implement the Federal Deposit Insurance Reform Act of 2005. The existing FDIC regulations on assessment dividends will expire on December 31, 2008. The document outlines alternative methods for distributing future dividends, considering factors like the reserve ratio and assessment bases of insured depository institutions.
key_terms: Federal Deposit Insurance Reform Act of 2005

regulation_details.regulation_name: Federal Deposit Insurance Reform Act of 2005

abstract: The document discusses methods for allocating dividends as part of the implementation of the Federal Deposit Insurance Reform Act of 2005. It provides a detailed analysis of two allocation methods: the fund balance method and the payments method. These methods determine dividend shares based on factors like the 1996 assessment base and eligible premiums paid after 1996. The analysis includes considerations of risk reduction incentives, treatment of older versus newer institutions, simplicity of methods, decision-making requirements, and potential impacts on institutions chartered in the future. It also invites public comments on the proposed dividend allocation approaches.
